message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with security issues in mobile ad hoc networks (MANETs), which are a type of wireless network. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper specifically focuses on detecting packet dropping attacks, which is a type of security attack, so cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is also a likely category. The paper proposes a mechanism that utilizes redundancy of routing information, which suggests that the paper may also belong to cs.DS (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) or cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). Finally, the paper proposes a fully cooperative scheme, which may also suggest that it belongs to cs.SY (Systems and Control).
